result.execSummary:
The defendant Marvell Clayton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any other sentence; STRAIGHT TIME

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court waived all non- mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay. Cash bail applied.

- No contact with firearms. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

- Batterers Intervention program.
- Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Treatment and/or counseling as determined by Agent.
- No Contact with victim, unless approved by Court or Agent.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Obtain GED/HSED/
- Cognitive Thinking class.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marvell Clayton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Per the agent, the defendant is in custody.  They are investigating another possible domestic violence charge.  Probation review date of 10/30/2015 vacated.  Agent to contact the court if another review date is necessary.
cab

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. Received & Filed, Victim Impact Statement.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 20 DAYS time served, straight time, consecutive to any other sentence.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 15 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 100 DAYS as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim, unless approved by court or agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-Obtain GED/HSED.
-Cognitive Thinking class.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

Filed: 
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation

Defendant Marvell Clayton in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marvell Clayton in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea & Sentencing. Defense counsel request an adjournment of Plea & Sentencing. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Marvell Clayton not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea & Sentencing date.  Defendant NOT produced from custody. Case heard off the record. Case adjourned for rescheduled Plea & Sentencing date to allow the defendant to be produced from State custody. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Case adjourned or Plea & Sentencing to branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

04/01/2015

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Marvell Clayton not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Case remains set for Plea & Sentencing on 4/7/2015 at 8:30 AM in branch 23.
Received & Filed, Motion for Modification of Bond. Case set for Bail/Bond Hearing on 3/31/2015 at 1:30 PM in branch 23.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Marvell Clayton not in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for Plea and Sentencing. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing to branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Julie F

Defendant Marvell Clayton in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Marvell Clayton in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Flanagan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Grady, Br. 23.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
